column3: and across the Channel to the Continent. But there were no ocean steamers
column5: and there were no steamers used for warlike purposes. As in the case of the wagon boilers
column6: the boilers of the paddle steamers of 1831 were most unsuited for resisting pressure. They were mere tanks
column7: and there was as much pressure when there was no steam in the boiler from the weight of the water on the bottom
column8: as there was at the top of the boiler from the steam pressure when the steam was up. Under these circumstances
column10: from 3½ lb. to 5 lb. was all the pressure the boilers were competent to bear
column11: and as the engines ran at a slow speed
column12: they developed but a small amount of horse-power in relation to their size.
